info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
At 604 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near White Clay to 14 miles northeast of Wild Horse Butte to 9 miles south of Alliance Airport. Movement was southeast at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Gordon, Rushville, Hay Springs, Ellsworth, White Clay, Antioch, Crescent Lake National Wildlife Refuge, Clinton, Intersection of Highway 87 and Craven Creek Road, Lone Butte, Intersection of Beaver Creek Road and White Clay Creek Road, Intersection of Highway 87 and Larabee Road, Pine Ridge, Miles Lake, Mumper, Wickson Lake, Diamond Lake, Metcalf State Wildlife Management Area, Herman Lake, and Krause Lake.
This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 74 and 110. Highway 250 between mile markers 1 and 48. Highway 2 between mile markers 96 and 121.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in North Platte.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN GARDEN AND SHERIDAN COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT
